content.text: GitHub CLI is not installed. Let me install it and set up authentication:

input.command: echo "deb [arch=$(dpkg --print-architecture) signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/githubcli-archive-keyring.gpg] https://cli.github.com/packages stable main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/github-cli.list > /dev/null

input.command: echo "deb [arch=amd64 signed-by=/usr/share/keyrings/githubcli-archive-keyring.gpg] https://cli.github.com/packages stable main" | sudo tee /etc/apt/sources.list.d/github-cli.list > /dev/null

todos.content: Check if GitHub CLI is installed
Install GitHub CLI if not present
Configure git to use GitHub credentials

content.content: Todos have been modified successfully. Ensure that you continue to use the todo list to track your progress. Please proceed with the current tasks if applicable

oldTodos.content: Check if GitHub CLI is installed
Install GitHub CLI if not present
Configure git to use GitHub credentials

newTodos.content: Check if GitHub CLI is installed
Install GitHub CLI if not present
Configure git to use GitHub credentials

content.text:
Perfect! GitHub CLI is installed. Now you need to authenticate with GitHub. You'll need to choose an authentication method:

**Option 1: Browser Authentication (Recommended)**
```bash
gh auth login
```
- Follow the prompts to authenticate via browser
- Select HTTPS protocol when asked
- Choose to authenticate with GitHub.com

**Option 2: Personal Access Token**
```bash
gh auth login --with-token
```
- Create a token at https://github.com/settings/tokens
- Requires `repo` scope for pushing code

**Option 3: SSH Key Authentication**
```bash
gh auth login
```
- Select SSH protocol
- Generate and add SSH key to GitHub

Which authentication method would you prefer to use?
